messages.subject: Application Received - Senior Backend Engineer
messages.body:
Hi Alex Chen,

Thank you for applying to the Senior Backend Engineer position on our Payments Infrastructure team. We've received your application and our recruiting team will review it shortly.

You can check your application status at any time by visiting our careers portal.

Best,
Stripe Recruiting

messages.subject: Re: Stripe - Senior Backend Engineer - Intro Call
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for your application — I reviewed your background and I'd love to set up an introductory call to tell you more about the role and learn about what you're looking for.

Would any of these times work for a 30-minute call?

- Monday 11/25 at 10am PT
- Monday 11/25 at 2pm PT
- Tuesday 11/26 at 11am PT

Looking forward to connecting!

Best,
Maya Rodriguez
Technical Recruiter, Stripe

messages.subject: Re: Stripe - Senior Backend Engineer - Intro Call
messages.body:
Hi Maya,

Thanks for reaching out! Tuesday 11/26 at 11am PT works great for me.

Looking forward to it!

Best,
Alex

messages.subject: Stripe Interview Invitation - Technical Phone Screen
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Great chatting with you last week! The team was impressed with your background and we'd like to move forward with a technical phone screen.

Here are the details:
- Date: Thursday, December 12th
- Time: 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM PT
- Format: 60-min coding interview via CoderPad
- Interviewer: Sarah Kim, Staff Engineer

The interview will focus on data structures, algorithms, and system design. You're welcome to use any language you're comfortable with.

Please confirm this works for you and I'll send a calendar invite.

Best,
Maya

messages.subject: Stripe Virtual Onsite - Schedule
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Exciting news — the team really enjoyed your phone screen and we'd like to invite you to a virtual onsite!

Date: January 8th, 2026
Time: 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM PT

Schedule:
9:00 - 10:00 — System Design (with James Liu, Engineering Manager)
10:15 - 11:15 — Coding Interview #1 (with Priya Patel, Senior Engineer)
11:30 - 12:30 — Coding Interview #2 (with Marcus Wong, Staff Engineer)
12:45 - 1:15 — Behavioral / Culture (with Diane Foster, Director of Engineering)
1:15 - 1:45 — Reverse Interview / Q&A with team

All sessions will be over Zoom. I'll send individual calendar invites shortly.

Let me know if you have any questions!

Best,
Maya

messages.subject: Stripe - Offer Letter
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

I'm thrilled to share that the team would like to extend you an offer for the Senior Backend Engineer role on the Payments Infrastructure team!

Here are the highlights:
- Base Salary: $225,000/year
- Equity: 5,000 RSUs vesting over 4 years (1-year cliff)
- Sign-on Bonus: $30,000
- Start Date: Flexible, targeting March 2026

I've attached the formal offer letter with full details including benefits, PTO policy, etc.

This offer is valid for 10 business days. I'd love to set up a call to walk through everything and answer any questions.

Congratulations, Alex! We're really excited about the possibility of you joining the team.

Best,
Maya

messages.subject: Your Application to Datadog - Senior Software Engineer, Platform
messages.body:
Dear Alex Chen,

Thank you for your interest in the Senior Software Engineer, Platform position at Datadog. Your application has been received and is currently under review.

Our recruiting team will reach out if your qualifications match our needs.

Best regards,
Datadog Talent Acquisition

messages.subject: Datadog - Senior Software Engineer, Platform - Next Steps
messages.body:
Hey Alex,

Tom here from the Datadog recruiting team. I've been reviewing your application for the Senior Software Engineer, Platform position and your experience at Cloudscale Systems caught my eye — sounds like you've been doing some really interesting distributed systems work.

I'd love to hop on a quick call to tell you more about the role and our team. Are you free for 30 min this week or early next week?

Cheers,
Tom Brennan
Sr. Technical Recruiter | Datadog

messages.subject: Datadog Onsite Complete - Next Steps
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks again for taking the time to come through our interview process. The feedback from the team has been overwhelmingly positive!

I'll be pulling together the debrief notes this week and will reach out with an update by end of week.

Hang tight!

Best,
Tom

messages.subject: Datadog - Offer Details
messages.body:
Alex!

Great news — we'd love to have you join Datadog as a Senior Software Engineer, Platform on the Observability Platform team.

Here's the offer summary:
- Base: $220,000
- Equity: $180,000 in RSUs (4-year vest, 1-year cliff)
- Sign-on: $25,000
- Location: Remote (you mentioned SF works, we have an office there too)

Full offer letter attached. Take your time reviewing — happy to jump on a call whenever you're ready to discuss.

We're really excited about this, Alex. The team thinks you'd be an amazing fit.

Tom

messages.subject: Notion - Senior Full-Stack Engineer - Recruiter Intro
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

I'm Rachel from the recruiting team at Notion. We reviewed your application and would love to learn more about your experience.

Do you have 30 minutes for an intro call next week? Here are some times that work:
- Tue 12/3 at 10am PT
- Wed 12/4 at 2pm PT
- Thu 12/5 at 11am PT

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Best,
Rachel Kim
Recruiter, Notion

messages.subject: Notion Virtual Onsite - Confirmed for Feb 20
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

You're all set for your virtual onsite on February 20th! Here's your schedule:

9:00 AM - 10:00 AM PT: System Design — with Kevin Zhao (Staff Eng)
10:15 AM - 11:15 AM PT: Coding — with Maria Santos (Senior Eng)
11:30 AM - 12:15 PM PT: Product Sense — with Jake Morrison (PM)
12:15 PM - 12:45 PM PT: Hiring Manager Chat — with Emily Wang (Eng Manager)

All sessions will be over Google Meet. Links will be in the calendar invites.

Some tips:
- System design: we care about your thought process more than a perfect answer
- Coding: we use CoderPad, choose whatever language you're most comfortable in
- Product sense: no right answer, we want to understand how you think about product

Let me know if you need to adjust anything. You've got this! 🎉

Rachel

messages.subject: Figma Interview - Senior Backend Engineer

Daniel Park

messages.subject: Figma Onsite - Confirmed for Feb 3
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Exciting! Your onsite is confirmed for Monday, February 3rd at our SF office (760 Market St, 5th Floor).

Schedule:
10:00 AM - 11:00 AM: System Design with Sarah Chen (EM)
11:15 AM - 12:15 PM: Coding with Alex Rivera (Staff Eng)
12:15 PM - 1:00 PM: Lunch with the team (casual, no evaluation)
1:00 PM - 1:45 PM: Behavioral with Pat Thompson (Director)
2:00 PM - 2:30 PM: Q&A / Reverse interview

Please bring your laptop and a valid ID for check-in.

Let me know if you have any questions!

Daniel

messages.subject: Re: Figma Onsite - Follow Up
messages.body:

Thanks so much for coming in on Monday! The team really enjoyed meeting you.

I'm collecting feedback now and will have an update for you by end of this week. Sit tight!

Best,
Daniel

messages.subject: Meridian Technologies - Phone Screen Complete

Kevin Walsh
Recruiter, Meridian Technologies

messages.subject: Acme Corp - Technical Screen Scheduled
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Your technical screen is confirmed:

Date: Wednesday, February 19th
Time: 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM PT
Format: Live coding via HackerRank
Interviewer: David Kim, Senior Engineer

The interview will cover algorithms and data structures. You can use any mainstream programming language.

Lisa Tran
Recruiter, Acme Corp

messages.subject: Palantir Technologies - Application Update
messages.body:
Dear Alex,

Thank you for taking the time to speak with us about the Forward Deployed Software Engineer role. After careful consideration, we've decided to move forward with other candidates whose experience more closely aligns with our current needs.

We were impressed by your technical skills and encourage you to apply again in the future as new positions open up.

We wish you the best in your job search.

Sincerely,
Amy Foster
Talent Acquisition, Palantir Technologies

messages.subject: Robinhood - Interview Update
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Thank you for investing your time in our interview process for the Senior Backend Engineer position. We truly appreciate the effort you put into each round.

After thorough deliberation, we've decided not to move forward at this time. This was a very competitive process and this decision does not reflect on your abilities — it came down to specific experience with low-latency trading systems that another candidate had.

We'd love to keep you in mind for future opportunities. Would you be open to us reaching out if something that's a better fit comes up?

All the best,
Chris Martinez
Technical Recruiter, Robinhood

messages.subject: Re: Plaid - Senior Software Engineer - Next Steps
messages.body:
Hi Josh,

Thanks for the update and for your time throughout the process. After some reflection, I've decided to withdraw my application. I have a couple of other opportunities that are a stronger fit for what I'm looking for right now.

I really appreciate the team's time and I hope we can stay in touch.

Best,
Alex

messages.subject: Re: Plaid - Senior Software Engineer - Next Steps
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

Completely understand! Thanks for letting me know and for being upfront about it. The team enjoyed meeting you.

Don't hesitate to reach out if anything changes or if you're looking again in the future. Best of luck with your other opportunities!

Cheers,
Josh

messages.subject: Opportunity at Confluent - Senior SWE, Streaming Platform
messages.body:
Hi Alex,

I came across your profile and was impressed by your experience with distributed systems at Cloudscale. We have an exciting opportunity on our Kafka Core team that I think could be a great fit.

Would you have 15 minutes this week to chat?

Best,
Nadia Petrova
Sr. Recruiter, Confluent

messages.subject: job search update / need advice
messages.body:
hey jordan,

so update on the job search - i've got offers from both stripe and datadog now. stripe is 225k base + 5000 RSUs, datadog is 220k + 180k RSUs. stripe also has a 30k sign-on.

still waiting to hear back from figma (onsite was last week, felt good) and notion onsite is on the 20th.

the stripe offer expires in like 10 business days so i need to figure this out soon. i'm leaning stripe but the datadog remote flexibility is tempting since i've been thinking about spending a few months in portugal lol.

what would you do? also do you think it's worth trying to negotiate? maya (stripe recruiter) seemed pretty firm on the numbers but idk.

drinks this weekend?

alex

messages.subject: Re: job search update / need advice
messages.body:
dude congrats!! both are amazing offers.

my 2 cents: ALWAYS negotiate. worst case they say no. you could use the datadog offer to push stripe up, and vice versa. classic play. the sign-on is nice but RSUs are where the real money is if stripe stock keeps climbing.

re: remote - yeah that's a real lifestyle thing. i know people at datadog and they're legit about remote. stripe is hybrid which means you're basically expected in office 3 days.

i'd say wait for figma before deciding. if figma comes through that's a whole different equation. also notion is a great company but they're a bit below market on comp in my experience so don't expect them to beat these.

drinks sat? barley & rye at 7?

jordan

messages.subject: Re: Stripe - Offer Letter
messages.body:
Hi Maya,

Thank you so much for the offer — I'm genuinely excited about the opportunity to join the Payments Infrastructure team.

I wanted to be transparent: I've also received a competitive offer from another company. I'm very interested in Stripe and it's my top choice, but I was wondering if there's any flexibility on the equity component? Specifically, would it be possible to discuss an increase in the RSU grant?

I'm happy to jump on a call to discuss if that's easier.

Best,
Alex
